item.title: Dollar Hegemony: A Power Analysis
item.description: Norrlof, Carla. “Dollar Hegemony: A Power Analysis.” Review of International Political Economy 21, no. 5 (2014): 1042-1070. The dollar has been the world’s first currency since the end of World War II, possibly since the inter-war period, and is the leading currency today. A growing chorus of observers believes this dollar-centered order is coming to an end. While much commentary revolves around changes in the distribution of power, measures are only loosely related to the material basis for currency dominance.
